content.description: Sit on the sharp rock same as for Ten Toads Down. Grab a thin crimp and pull through towards the dark angled chunk near the lip. Do some shuffling until you can roll over the lip with your foot on that same dark chunk.
content.protection: One or two pads will suffice.
content.location: The Toad boulder is in the center of the first Wincopin quarry and is hard to miss when approaching from the lower quarry trail.

content.description: Sit on the very sharp rock and work your way up good edges until you can reach out to the satisfying arete on your right. Do some compression work until you feel comfortable snatching the jug towards the middle of the boulder. This climb is great fun and the rock quality is very confidence inspiring for the area.
content.protection: One or two pads will suffice.
content.location: The toad boulder is right in the middle of the first quarry and is very obvious when approaching from the lower quarry trail. There is a tallerÂ

content.description: In the first quarry when approaching from the Wincopin Trailhead there is the toad boulder and a few other interesting but chossy pieces of rock. This area doesn't get much sun and will take longer to dry after rain than the second quarry - located further down the trail.
